Yes, here are some tips for reducing eye strain while using smartphones or tablets:

1. Reduce screen brightness: Lower the brightness of your screen to a comfortable level, especially when using your device in low-light conditions.

2. Increase text size: Use the text size settings to increase the font size, making it easier to read without straining your eyes.

3. Adjust font styles: Some fonts may be easier on your eyes than others. Experiment with different font styles to see which one works best for you.

4. Use night mode: Most devices come with a night mode or blue light filter feature that reduces the blue light emission from the screen, reducing eye strain.

5. Increase font contrast: Increase the contrast between the background and text to make text easier to read.

6. Take breaks: Just like with computer use, take frequent breaks from your device, give your eyes a rest, and look away into the distance.

7. Use the correct distance from your eyes: Hold your device about an arm's length away from your face with your eyes at the same level as the screen.

8. Reduce glare: Use a matte screen protector or anti-glare filter to reduce glare and reflections.

By adopting these practices, you'll help reduce eye strain while using your smartphone or tablet.
